docs.lead_paragraph: She was a tall, spare woman, sallow of coloring, lustreless of eye, with stooping shoulders, and hard, gnarled hands. For forty years she had been the wife of the man who sat beside her in the lawyer's office, and those forty years had been spent in the hard manual labor, the perennial baking and brewing, the almost ceaseless round of toil that belongs to the lot of farmers' wives.
